Brunno,

In Open Source you can do it without needing to ask permission. Wh=
en you are
ready just announce on this list, http://testdriven.com , and
ht=
tp://xprogramming.com . That should give you enough publicity to get
people=
 to take a look at it.

Regards,
David
www.testdriven.com

On 5/9/06, Brunn=
o Silva <brunno.silva@...> wrote:
>
> Dear list members,
>
> In th=
e begining of the year, I started to use TDD in
> my projects, must of them=
, however, used the Java ME
> technology. JUnit doesn't workly properly in =
this
> case, because it uses the Java Reflection API. Soon, I
> discovered =
the J2MEUnit, but it's too poor documented,
> it's very difficult to use it=
. So, I created my own
> xUnit implementation, the JMUnit (Java Micro Unit)=
.
> It's very primitive yet (the current version has done
> three months ag=
o, in four hours), but it worked well
> in my projects. So, I had the idea =
to put this version
> in the source forge and start to aprimorate it. My
> =
question is: Do exist any formality to create and
> distribute a xUnit impl=
ementation or anyone can do it
> without problems?
>
> Sincerely yours,
> B=
runno Silva
